_Explain: Armor crafted specifically for members of the expedition. The mask keeps the sand out.
Armor crafted specifically for members of the expedition. An all-seasons design for any clime.
Armor crafted specifically for members of the expedition. Pliant fingers help with precision work.
Armor crafted specifically for members of the expedition. It is optimized for quick access.
Armor crafted specifically for members of the expedition. It can handle nearly any terrain.
Head armor made of treated monster hide. A safe choice, designed for multi-purpose use.
Simple chest armor reinforced with monster hide. A design that maximizes wearability.
Armguards reinforced with monster hide. They're light, but provide ample protection.
Waistgear reinforced with monster hide. Hunters swear by its no-nonsense functionality.
Leg armor reinforced with monster hide. Molds to the body with extended use.
Head armor made of woven chain links. Its familiar design inspires trust in hunters who wear it.
Chest armor made of woven chain links. Tried and true, it offers solid, functional defense.
Armguards made of woven chain links. They're easy to use and a breeze to maintain.
Waistgear made of woven chain links. A smart combination of materials keeps it extra light.
Leg armor made of woven chain links. The clever weave prevents it from impairing movement.
Traditional head armor crafted from monster bones. Believe it or not, it offers pretty good insulation.
Traditional chest armor with a unique plating of intricately pieced together monster bones.
Traditional armguards made from monster bones. It's a wonder these mismatched shapes fit together.
Traditional waistgear bound with monster bones. Looks crude, but it does the job.
Traditional leg armor crafted from monster bones so light it's like wearing nothing at all.
Spectacles made from Bulaqchi parts. The hottest new design for the stylish hunter.
Talioth armguards. The forearm blades are a classic example of style over practicality.
Chatacabra head armor. The design is specially tailored for desert hunting.
Chatacabra chest armor. Equipped with generous elastic cushioning in the collar.
Chatacabra armguards. They protect the wrists without hampering weapon handling.
Chatacabra waistgear. The charming, heart-shaped pouch is made from its ample tongue.
Leg armor made from Chatacabra spoils. A loose fit for maximum mobility.
Head armor made from Quematrice spoils. The shock of feathers ties the whole look together.
Quematrice chest armor. The design may look ceremonial, but it offers ample protection.
Armguards made from Quematrice parts. The wide cuffs allow the wrists to move unimpeded.
Flaunt-worthy Quematrice waistgear. Nothing shouts haute couture like flowing tassets.
Quematrice leg armor. The ornate gaiters let a hunter strut like a Quematrice.
A helmet crafted from quality ore. While it doesn't look like much, this is highly functional armor.
Chest armor crafted from quality ore. Made with a logical, no-frills construction that puts mobility first.
Armguards crafted from quality ore. Every element is streamlined for maximum utility.
Waistgear crafted from quality ore. The complexly shaded patina and sleek design are quite stunning.
Leg armor crafted from quality ore. What it lacks in charm it more than makes up in defense.
Piragill leg armor. A light, skintight fit made with the most exquisite, buttery-soft leather.
A Vespoid helmet. The carapace material is susceptible to fire but offers sturdy coverage.
Vespoid chest armor. Its arcane build provides formidable resistance to physical attacks.
Vespoid armguards. They are as heavy as they look, but they afford significant defense.
Vespoid waistgear. The design arose from the study of highly defensive exoskeletons.
Leg armor made from Vespoid parts. Ingenious artisanship has further reinforced the carapace.
Lala Barina head armor. The rose embellishments were fashioned from its carapace.
Lala Barina chest armor. It may look like normal clothing, but it's just as hardy as armor.
Lala Barina armguards that are so elegant they could pass as formal wear.
Lala Barina waistgear that nobility would gladly don just to make an impression.
Lala Barina leg armor. Pulls the rose motif back in with subtle but elegant detailing.
Head armor made from Congalala materials. Remember: it's "feral," not "unkempt."
Chest armor made from Congalala materials. The shocks of monster fur help hunters keep it wild.
Armguards made from Congalala materials. Crudely made but highly protective.
Waistgear made from Congalala materials, complete with an array of handy pockets!
Greaves made of Congalala parts. Wild crafting perfect for those who run in the wilderness.
A Balahara helmet covered in roughly polished protrusions to strongly evoke its namesake.
Balahara chest armor. The bulky shoulders are roomy enough to allow ample movement.
Balahara armguards. The spikes are arranged artfully in a way that maximizes movement.
Balahara waistgear. The fabric is colored a shade of red that stirs a competitive spirit.
Spiny Balahara leg armor. The carapace has been split into clever, fluid parts.
Head armor made from Doshaguma parts. Pity any enemy who dares scoff at its imposing crest.
Doshaguma chest armor. The lush shocks of fur function as a robust defensive layer.
Doshaguma armguards. Teeming with such feral power, they had to be restrained with metal bracers.
Waistgear made from Doshaguma parts. Nothing can muss the thick pile of this sturdy sash.
Doshaguma leg armor. Whether dune or sandstorm, nothing can slow its wearer's progress.
Uth Duna head armor. The plumage crafted from its fins convey the forest's will to the wearer.
Uth Duna chest armor. The tightly fitted scales make the wearer feel as if they are one with nature.
Uth Duna armguards. The rows of stone beading are an elegant touch that boosts concentration.
Uth Duna waistgear. The fabric is imbued with the breath of the forest, absorbing any impact.
Elaborately patterned Uth Duna leg armor. The design is said to invoke the forest's protection.
Head armor fashioned from lustrous, golden ore. Regal protection with a crown to complete the look.
Chest armor crafted from brilliant golden ore. Its color and design are both highly pleasing.
Armguards fashioned from lustrous, golden ore. A union of artistry and utility with no absence of durability.
Waistgear fashioned from lustrous, golden ore. It joins haute design with the very latest in armor craft.
Leg armor fashioned from lustrous, golden ore. Clever smithing makes the metal feel fluid and light.
Kranodath chest armor. What armor enthusiast could resist such ornate plating?
Rompopolo head armor. The mask is needed to ward off the material's residual toxins.
Well-padded Rompopolo chest armor. The fabric contains poison that—supposedly—never leaks.
Rompopolo armguards. The poisonous needles in the claws are neat, but tricky to use.
Rompopolo waistgear fully equipped with instruments needed to handle poison.
Rompopolo leg armor. Careful you don't accidentally lean on those spare vials of poison...
Rey Dau head armor. Its crest reaches the heavens—proof that this creature bows to no one.
Rey Dau chest armor. Its carapace has been meticulously paneled into a bastion of defense.
Rey Dau armguards. A lingering charge gives the wearer a grip like a vice.
Rey Dau waistgear. The faintly glowing buckle inspires awe and respect.
Rey Dau leg armor. A layer of latent electricity cushions blows and softens landings.
A Comaqchi head accessory. The thin, sleek plating emanates an eldritch gleam.
A helmet made from Nerscylla spoils. Protection this durable requires masterful precision and execution.
Chest armor made from Nerscylla materials. Advanced engineering makes it feel impossibly light.
Armguards made from Nerscylla spoils. Extra play in the fingers helps improve weapon handling.
Waistgear made from Nerscylla spoils. A work of art that exhibits a deep dedication to armor craft.
Leg armor made from Nerscylla spoils. It keeps hunters light on their feet and looking good in action.
Head armor made from Hirabami spoils. It keeps the wearer attuned and bound to the wind at all times.
Chest armor made from Hirabami spoils. The style is inspired by the gallant warriors of a foreign land.
Armguards made from Hirabami spoils. Wind rises at the fingertips in warning to all adversaries.
Waistgear made from Hirabami spoils. The elegant sash harnesses the wind to mitigate impacts.
Leg armor made from Hirabami spoils. Designed for mobility, they feel like walking on wind.
Imposing Ajarakan head armor. Donning it will draw the fires from within to burst forth.
Ajarakan chest armor. The heat of its flames warns prey of their final immolation.
Mighty Ajarakan armguards. They have just as much ground-shaking power as their namesake.
Ajarakan waistgear. It acts as a tether to quell the wearer's exploding rage.
Flame crested Ajarakan leg armor. A heat so fierce that each step makes the earth shudder in agony.
Nu Udra head armor. The world through this mask is swathed in vengeance and ebony fire.
Nu Udra chest armor. As if a curse manifested, tentacles drape down to form a haunting cape.
Chilling Nu Udra armguards. They warp one's sense of touch, changing warmth to cold nothingness.
Nu Udra waistgear. The gnash of spikes and fangs are bound by a personalized curse.
Nu Udra leg armor. The wearer could cross a sea of fire without so much as a blister.
Guardian Seikret waistgear. The long, white feathers produce a faint, exquisite glow.
Head armor made from Guardian Doshaguma spoils. To don it is to be seized by unspeakable cravings.
Chest armor made from Guardian Doshaguma spoils. It instills a new vitality and sense of purpose.
Armguards made from Guardian Doshaguma spoils. They agitate the wearer unless in constant motion.
Waistgear made from Guardian Doshaguma spoils. The white areas self-repair when damaged.
Leg armor made from Guardian Doshaguma spoils. Produces a faint white aura when worn.
Head armor made from Guardian Rathalos spoils. To don it is to be seized by unspeakable cravings.
Chest armor made from Guardian Rathalos spoils. It instills a new vitality and sense of purpose.
Armguards made from Guardian Rathalos spoils. They agitate the wearer unless in constant motion.
Waistgear made from Guardian Rathalos spoils. The white areas self-repair when damaged.
Leg armor made from Guardian Rathalos spoils. Produces a faint white aura when worn.

Waistgear made from Guardian Ebony Odogaron spoils. The white areas self-repair when damaged.
Leg armor made from Guardian Ebony Odogaron spoils. Produces a faint white aura when worn.
Concealing Xu Wu head armor. Fitting attire for hunters who dwell in darkness.
Xu Wu chest armor. The long scarf can be used as protective gear and multi-purpose rope.
Xu Wu armguards. The clever design gives the wearer's fingers a nimble edge even in the dark.
Slinky Xu Wu waistgear. The uniquely textured leather moves silent as a whisper.
Xu Wu leg armor. Meticulously crafted to allow the wearer to slink silently through the dark.
Guardian Arkveld head armor. A host of heightened senses make up for the narrow view.
Guardian Arkveld chest armor. It beckons forth a shudder of indescribable power.
Guardian Arkveld armguards. Instills the desire to tear at friend and foe alike.
Guardian Arkveld waistgear. The chains writhe subtly, eager to ensnare prey.
Guardian Arkveld leg armor. Their power grows with each relentless, hungry step.
